action_rule_setup_h.intro_Txt: Action Rule setup enables setting up of rules to define how and when the Axis product will perform certain actions. Action Rule can be setup as scheduled, recurring or for example, trigged by motion detection.
action_rule_setup_h.general_Txt1: Enable rule - This box must be checked for the rule to be active.
action_rule_setup_h.general_Txt2: Name - Provide a descriptive name for the Action Rule. This name will be displayed in the Action Rules List.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_Txt: A Trigger initiates the Action Rule which in turn starts certain actions. Listed below are the triggers available in this product. Select a group from the drop-down list and a second drop-down list will appear from which the desired trigger can be selected.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_appTrigger_Txt: Applications - Triggers the Action Rule through an application installed in Axis product. The use of this trigger depends on the purpose or function of the installed application. For more information on available applications, please see Application Packages or the Axis web site at www.axis.com
action_rule_setup_h.audioDetect_Txt: Audio Detection - Triggers the Action Rule when sound level rises above or falls below the alarm level. It can be used to start/stop recording or to notify operator in case of detection.
action_rule_setup_h.audioDetect_Txt_multisource: From the third drop-down list select the audio channel to be used.
action_rule_setup_h.audioDetect_more_info1_Txt: For more information, see Audio Detection.
action_rule_setup_h.audioDetect_more_info2_Txt: For more information, see Audio Settings.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_onfilter_Txt1: Day/Night Mode - Triggers the Action Rule when the camera switches between day and night mode (e.g. automatic IR Cut filter). It can be used to control an external infrared (IR) light through the output port.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_onfilter_Txt2: Yes - Triggers the Action Rule when the camera is in day mode or switches to day mode.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_onfilter_Txt3: No - Triggers the Action Rule when the camera is in night mode or switches to night mode.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_enterExit_Txt: Enter-Exit Detection - Triggers the Action rule when the Axis product detects that an object has entered or exited the area. It can be used to, for example, send a notification to the operator when an object enters or exits a defined area. Enter-Exit detection must first be enabled through Setup > Detectors.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_fenceDetection_Txt: Fence Detection - Triggers the Action rule when the Axis product detects that an object has crossed a virtual line. It can be used to, for example, send a notification to the operator when someone enters unauthorized area. Fence detector must first be enabled through Setup > Detectors.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_objectRemoved_Txt: Object Removed - Triggers the Action rule when the Axis product detects that an object has been removed from a scene. It can be used to, for example, send a notification to the operator when someone has removed an object of interest from where it was placed. Object removed detector must first be enabled through Setup > Detectors.
action_rule_setup_h.live_view_accessed_Txt: Live Stream Accessed - Triggers the Action Rule when a client accesses the live stream. The stream can be of any media type such as video, audio etc. The Action Rule can make use of status LED or an external light to notify persons that someone is actively monitoring.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_motion_Txt: Motion Detection - Triggers the Action Rule when the Axis product built-in motion detection detects movement in a motion detection window. It is used mostly to control when to start recording and when not to with respect to motion detection window. Select the motion detection window from the drop-down list and specify whether to trigger Action Rule when there is movement or when there is no movement (Yes/No). A motion detection window needs to be created for the Motion detection trigger to be enabled. More about Motion Detection.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_PIR: PIR - Triggers the Action Rule when the PIR sensor detects motion. The passive infrared sensor is an electronic device that measures infrared (IR) light radiating from objects in its field of view. It is typically used to detect motion in dark areas and trigger the rule to perform actions such as record video, send notification etc. For more help see PIR Sensor.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_tamper_Txt: Tampering - Triggers the Action Rule when someone has tampered with the camera. It can be used to notify operator if for example the camera has been repositioned or if the lens has been covered. For more help see Camera Tampering.
action_rule_setup_h.tamper_Txt_multisource_video_Txt: From the third drop-down list select the video channel to be used.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_shockDetection_Txt: Shock Detection - Triggers the Action rule when the Axis product detects it has been tilted or hit. It can be used to, for example, send a notification to the operator when someone has hit or rotated the product. Shock detection must first be enabled through Setup > Detectors > Camera Tampering > Enable shock detection.
action_rule_setup_h.triggerCasingOpen_Txt: Casing Open - Triggers the Action Rule if the casing of a connected external device, such as a junction box is removed or opened. It can be used to send a notification to an operator if for example the casing has been opened for maintenance purposes or when someone has tampered with the casing.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_fan_Txt: Fan - Triggers the Action Rule if the fan fails.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt1: Network - Triggers the Action Rule when Axis product looses network connection. Select one of the following options depending on the type of network connection used.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt2: Any - Triggers the Action Rule if any of the network connection (cable or wireless) is lost.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt3: eth0 - Triggers the Action Rule if network cable connection is lost.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt4: eth1 - Triggers the Action Rule if wireless network connection is lost.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt5: Select Yes radio button to trigger the Action Rule if the network connection is lost. Select No radio button to trigger the Action Rule when the network connection is restored.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_network_lost2_Txt: Network - Triggers the Action Rule when network connection is lost. Select Yes radio button to trigger the Action Rule if the network connection is lost. Select No radio button to trigger the Action Rule when the network connection is restored.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_temp_Txt: Temperature - Triggers the Action Rule when temperature is above, below, inside or outside the operating range of the Axis product. In this scenario, the product can be set to notify operator.
action_rule_setup_h.triggerAudioConnector_Txt: Audio Connector - Triggers the Action Rule when audio cable is connected or disconnected from the Axis product. It can be used to notify an operator that audio cable has been disconnected for example when someone has tampered with the product.
action_rule_setup_h.triggerRackFan_Txt: Fan - Triggers the Action Rule if the rack's fan fails. It can be used to send maintenance notifications to an operator.
action_rule_setup_h.triggerPowerSupplyFail_Txt: Power Supply Failure - Triggers the Action Rule if the rack's power supply fails. It can be used to send maintenance notifications to an operator.
action_rule_setup_h.triggerTemperatureCritical_Txt: Temperature Critical - Triggers the Action Rule when the rack's temperature is above the maximum operating range, in this case the trigger may be used to send a notification to an operator.
action_rule_setup_h.RackTriggersNote_Txt: Note: Fan, Power Supply Failure and Temperature Critical triggers are only available in channel 1 of the first blade in a rack.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_videoloss_Txt: Video Signal - Triggers the Action Rule if video signal to Axis product is lost. This trigger can be used in conjunction with pretrigger recording to allow viewing of the recording up to the point when video signal was lost. It can also be used to notify operator that a server has lost video signal.
action_rule_setup_h.videoloss_note_Txt1: Note: When using this trigger, the video source to detect video loss on does not have to be the same source as otherwise used by the trigger type. This means that it is possible to configure the trigger so that losing the video signal on one input will trigger an upload from another video source.
action_rule_setup_h.videoloss_note_Txt2: However, if the same video source is used in both cases, this will disable post-trigger upload and continued image upload (see below).
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_inputs_Txt1: Input Signal - Below are the types of input ports supported by this Axis product.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_inputs_Txt5: Configure I/O ports under System Options > Ports & Devices.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_inputs_Txt2: Digital Input Port - Triggers the Action Rule when digital input port changes state. It can be used to initiate various actions such as send notification, send images, record video etc. In third drop-down list, select an input port to trigger the Action Rule when that specific input port is active. Or select Any to trigger Action Rule when any input port is active.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_inputs_Txt3: Manual Trigger - Triggers the Action Rule when manual trigger button changes state. It can be used to start or stop the Action Rule manually through Live View page. For this trigger to work, manual trigger button must be enabled in Live View Layout.
action_rule_setup_h.select_view_area_Txt: Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_inputs_Txt4: Virtual Inputs - Triggers the Action Rule when any of the virtual inputs changes states. It can be used by external client such as Video Management Systems to initiate various actions. In the third drop-down list, select an input port to trigger the Action Rule when that specific input port is active.
action_rule_setup_h.ptzAutoTrack_Txt: Autotracking - Triggers the Action Rule when PTZ autotracking starts, that is, autotracking has detected a moving object in the camera's field of view. It can be used to trigger the Action Rule to send a notification when autotracking starts to operate due to movement in the monitored area.
action_rule_setup_h.ptzError_Txt: PTZ Error - Triggers the Action Rule when Axis product encounters a serious PTZ error, for example it cannot tilt, zoom etc. This trigger can be used to notify operator that there is a problem with PTZ.
action_rule_setup_h.ptzError_view_area_Txt: Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.ptzMove_Txt: Moving - Triggers the Action Rule when Axis product moves or not due to a PTZ operation. It can be used as an Additional Condition to stop other actions such as motion detection when PTZ is moving.
action_rule_setup_h.ptzMove_view_area_Txt: Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_preset_reached_Txt1: Preset Reached - Triggers the Action Rule when the view reaches at a preset position. This is useful for saving images from a guard tour, without saving images from when the Axis product is moving between presets or it can be used to upload an image at each preset position.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_preset_reached_Txt2: In the next drop-down list, select Any to trigger the Action Rule when any preset position is reached.
action_rule_setup_h.ptzPreset_view_area_Txt: Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_preset_reached_Txt3: Note: for the option Preset reached - choose Yes to trigger the Action Rule when preset position is reached (Axis product is stationary) or choose No to trigger the Action Rule when preset position is left (Axis product start moving).
action_rule_setup_h.ptzReady_Txt: Ready - Triggers the Action Rule when PTZ is in ready status, for example Axis product can detect and send a notification when PTZ is ready to be used after restart. This trigger can be used to move Axis product to a specific preset position after restart.
action_rule_setup_h.ptzReady_view_area_Txt: Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt1: Storage - Notifies operator that there exists storage related issues that need to be responded to.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt2: Available - Triggers the Action Rule when storage device is unmounted or removed.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt3: Full - Triggers the Action Rule when storage device is full. Under normal conditions Axis product will cleanup old recordings before the storage is full.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt4: Locked - Triggers the Action Rule when storage device has been locked (write protected).
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_StorageDisruption_Txt: Storage Disruption - Triggers the Action Rule when storage problems are detected. This trigger may be used to send a notification to an operator if the storage device is unavailable, removed, full, locked or if there is a read or write problem. The operator may need to check the logs under System Options > Support > Logs & Reports to identify the problem and take necessary measures to fix them e.g. unmount and re-mount the storage device etc.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt6: Select the storage device from the drop-down list and select Yes for notification to be sent for example when the storage device is unmounted or removed, full, locked or if storage disruption is detected.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_recStatus_Txt: Recording - Triggers the Action Rule when the Axis product records to the storage device. The recording status trigger can be used to notify the operator e.g by flashing LED lights, if the product has started or stopped to record to the storage device. Note that, this trigger can be used only for edge storage recording status.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_ready_Txt1: System Ready - Triggers the Action Rule when the system is in ready status, for example Axis product can detect and send a notification to operator after it has started.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_ready_Txt2: Select Yes radio button to trigger the Action Rule when the product is in Ready state. Note that the rule will only trigger when all necessary services such as event system have started.
action_rule_setup_h.trigger_ready_Txt3: Note: Action Rule will not be triggered when the No radio button is selected.
action_rule_setup_h.recur_Txt: Recurrence - Triggers the Action Rule by monitoring predefined recurrences. It can be used to initiate recurring actions for example upload image every 30 minutes etc. Select name of a recurrence pattern from the drop-down list. For more information about setting up a recurrence pattern, see Recurrences.
action_rule_setup_h.time_schedule_Txt: Use Schedule -Triggers the Action Rule by monitoring state of predefined schedules. It can be used to record video in specific time period example office hours, weekends etc. select a schedule in the Schedule drop-down list. Select a schedule in the Schedule drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.sched_Txt2: Triggers the Action Rule at predefined times for example weekends, after certain hours etc. Schedule can also be used to initiate actions such as record video, send images etc. at a certain defined time. Select a schedule to be used from the drop-down list. To add a new schedule, click the New Schedule button and enter the required details. For more information about setting up schedules, see Schedules.
action_rule_setup_h.addlConditions_Txt2: Check this box if there is more than one criterion that should be met before the Action Rule is triggered. Description of the conditions is the same as for those under Condition > Trigger above. Note that for the Action Rule to be triggered, all triggers selected under Trigger or Schedule and Additional conditions must be active.
action_rule_setup_h.addlConditions_Txt3: To add a new condition, Click Add... and select a condition from the drop-down list, to change an existing condition, select condition in the list and click Modify... To delete a condition, select it and click Remove. Set a waiting time in Wait at least field to prevent Action Rule from running too often. The Action Rule needs to be re-triggered after the set waiting time in order to execute the action again.
action_rule_setup_h.actions_intro: From the drop-down list choose an action. If for whatever reason the action fails to take place, for example an error with an email server, click Fail over action to enter an alternate action.
action_rule_setup_h.night_vision_Txt: Day/Night Vision Mode - Sets Auto mode, day mode or night mode. When this mode is selected, the Action Rule will switch the IR cut filter to Auto mode (depending on lighting conditions), to Day mode (IR cut filter on) or to Night mode (IR cut filter off). Note that the IR cut filter setting in Video & Audio > Camera Settings page must not be set to Auto.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_txt: IR Light - Turns on the built-in Infrared (IR) light illuminator. It can be used in an Action Rule to turn on the IR light illuminator so that the camera can perform video surveillance in areas with low light, without requiring addition of external lighting.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_txt-1: IR Illumination - Turns on the built-in Infrared (IR) light illuminator. It can be used in an Action Rule to turn on the IR light illuminator so that the camera can perform video surveillance in areas with low light, without requiring addition of external lighting.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_active_txt: Activate IR light while trigger is active - The light will be activated while the trigger is active.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_active_txt-1: Activate IR illumination while trigger is active - The light will be activated while the trigger is active.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_deactive_txt: Deactivate IR light while trigger is active - The light will be deactivated while the trigger is active.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_deactive_txt-1: Deactivate IR illumination while trigger is active - The light will be deactivated while the trigger is active.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_deactive_oneshot_txt: Deactivate IR light - The light will be deactivated.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_deactive_oneshot_txt-1: Deactivate IR illumination - The light will be deactivated.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_remain_active_txt: Remain active as long as trigger is active (duration) - The light will be activated as long as the trigger is active.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_active_oneshot_txt: Activate IR light - The light will be activated.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_light_active_oneshot_txt-1: Activate IR illumination - The light will be activated.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_illumination_txt1: IR Illumination - Turns on the Infrared (IR) illumination. It can be used in an Action Rule to turn on IR illumination so that the camera can perform video surveillance in areas with low light, without requiring addition of external lighting.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_illumination_txt2: Activate IR illumination while trigger is active - IR illumination will be activated while the trigger is active.
action_rule_setup_h.ir_illumination_txt3: Deactivate IR illumination - IR illumination will be deactivated.
action_rule_setup_h.overlaytext_Txt1: Overlay Text - Displays a text on top of a video stream image when the Action Rule is triggered. The text can be used to provide information for forensic video analysis, notify operators or validate triggers and actions during product installation and configuration.
action_rule_setup_h.overlayText_view_area_Txt: Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.overlaytext_Txt2: Note: To display the overlay text when the Action Rule is triggered, the modifier #D must be used in Video & Audio > Video Stream > Image > Overlay Settings > Include text.
action_rule_setup_h.output_Txt1: Output Port - Controls external equipment connected to a port on Axis product. Select the port and set the port to trigger when it is active or inactive. Configure I/O ports under System Options > Ports & Devices.
action_rule_setup_h.output_Txt2: Duration - Set when the output port should be put in opposite state. Choose between when the Action Rule is no longer active or after a set time.
action_rule_setup_h.activatelight_Txt1: Activate Light - Turns on the built-in light illuminator so that the camera can take clear images in dark environments. For example, if the PIR sensor detects motion in a dark environment, this action can be used to illuminate the scene while the camera records video or saves snapshot images.
action_rule_setup_h.activatelight_Txt2: Keep active during rule - The light will be activated as long as the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.activatelight_Txt3: Keep active for (duration) - Enter the number of seconds/minutes the light should be activated.
action_rule_setup_h.activatelight_Txt4: It is also possible to control the Activate and Inactivate behavior according to special requirements.
action_rule_setup_h.audioclip_Txt: Play Audio Clip - Plays a recorded audio clip when the Action Rule is triggered. It can be used to automatically notify operator that Axis product has detected movement. From the Play drop-down list, select an audio clip to play when the Action Rule is triggered. To add new audio clips go to Video & Audio > Audio Clips.
action_rule_setup_h.pTZcontrol_Txt: PTZ Control - Moves Axis product to a specified position when the Action Rule is triggered.
action_rule_setup_h.pTZcontrol_view_areas_Txt1: This action is available only if view area is enabled in Camera Settings.
action_rule_setup_h.pTZcontrol_view_areas_Txt1-1: This action is available only if view area is enabled in Camera Settings and if PTZ is enabled in View Areas.
action_rule_setup_h.pTZcontrol_view_areas_Txt2: Select view area - Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.preSet_Txt: Preset Position - Moves the Axis product to a specified position when the Action Rule is triggered. Use the option go to Home for Axis product to return to home preset position. It is also possible to set number of seconds for the product to wait before returning to home preset, this is done by checking the box return home when rule is no longer active and entering the number of seconds to wait before returning to home preset.
action_rule_setup_h.runtourTxt: Guard Tour - When this option is selected, the Action Rule will start the tour selected in guard tour drop-down list. Check the box if you want the tour to stop when Action Rule is no longer active. Check Return to home position if you would like the tour to return to the preset home position.
action_rule_setup_h.action_AT_Txt: Autotracking - This action is used to start autotracking from a preset position, that is, to go to the preset position and from that position follow a moving object within the camera's field of view. Check the box Return to home position for Axis product to return to home preset when Autotracking is inactive or enter number of seconds for the product to delay before returning to home preset.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt1: Record Video - Records video to a selected storage.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt2: Select view area - Choose view area from which to record video when the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt3: Stream profile - Select the type of stream profile. Listed below are default stream profiles as well as any created under Stream Profiles.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt3-1: Stream profile - Select the type of stream profile. Listed below are default stream profiles as well as any created under Stream Profiles. Note that, if no stream profile is selected, the default stream that is shown in the Live View page will be used.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt4: Duration - Set the length of the video to record.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt5: Pre-trigger time - Enter the number of seconds to include in the recording from time immediately before the rule was triggered.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt6: While the rule is active - Records only while the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt7: Post-trigger time - Enter the number of seconds to include immediately after the rule is no longer active. If While the rule is active is enabled, the time entered here will be added to the recording time after the rule is no longer active.
action_rule_setup_h.select_recordVideo_Txt8: Storage - Select where to save the recorded video from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt1: Send Images - Sends images to recipients such as HTTP, Email, FTP server etc.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt2: Select view area - Choose view area from which to send images when the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt3: Stream profile - Select JPEG stream profile to save the images. Listed are the stream profiles that have been created under Stream Profiles. The default JPEG stream profile uses default image settings defined under Video Stream in Video & Audio menu.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt4: Image frequency - Set the desired image frequency in number of frames per second, minute or hour.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt4-1: Image frequency - Set the desired image frequency in number of frames per second, minute or hour. The default value 0 (zero) implies that maximum framerate from the stream profile will be used. To limit the image frequency, enter a different value. Note that, framerate is dependent on the capture mode and stream profile settings.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt5: Duration - Set the length of time for the images.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt6: Pre-trigger time - Enter the number of seconds to include in the sent images from time immediately before the rule was triggered.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt7: While the rule is active - Sends the images only while the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt8: Post-trigger time - Enter the number of seconds to include immediately after the rule is no longer active. If While the rule is active is enabled, the time entered here will be added to the sent images time after the rule is no longer active.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt10: Send only the first - Enter the maximum number of images to be sent.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt11: Recipient - Recipients FTP, HTTP, HTTPS, Network share and email address (SMTP) are used to receive uploaded media files and notification messages. Select a recipient from the drop-down list or add a new one by clicking New Recipient.
action_rule_setup_h.emailSendLimit_Txt: Note: Some email providers have security filters that prevent users from receiving or viewing large amount of attachments, from receiving scheduled emails and similar. Check the email provider's security policy to avoid your email account being locked or missing on your expected emails.
action_rule_setup_h.emailSendLimit_Txt-1: Some email providers have security filters that prevent users from receiving or viewing large amount of attachments, from receiving scheduled emails and similar. Check the email provider's security policy to avoid your email account being locked or missing on your expected emails.
action_rule_setup_h.sendImages_Txt12: Select view area - Select the desired view area from the drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt1: Send Notification - Sends notification to recipients HTTP, HTTPS, Email and TCP. Select a recipient from the drop-down list or add a new one by clicking New Recipient.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt3: Message parameter - This message will be received in a CGI-variable called 'Message' on the target HTTP server. Note that including more than the maximum of 255 characters in this field will exclude some or all of the contents of Custom parameter. Spaces are allowed. For a list of modifiers that can be used in notifications, see modifiers.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt3-1: Message parameter - Enter the message or leave it empty. Message parameter is used when you have a CGI, that is, a HTTP server that can receive a CGI-variable called 'Message'.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt3-2: Example: If the complete syntax is http://servername/axis-cgi/restart.cgi, then add the message 'restart' in the Message parameter field.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt3-3: Note that, including more than the maximum of 255 characters in this field will exclude some or all of the contents of Custom parameter. Spaces are allowed. For a list of modifiers that can be used in notifications, see modifiers.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt4: Custom parameter - Add any extra parameters here. Click Add and enter the name and parameter value. Note that it is allowed to use spaces in the value field but not in the name field.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt4-1: Custom parameter - Add any extra parameters here. Click Add and enter the name and parameter value.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt4-2: In the Name field, enter the name of the VAPIXÂ® command argument, for example, gotoserverpresetname.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt4-3: In the Value field, enter the parameter's value. This can be, for example, a PTZ preset position number or name.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt4-4: Note that, it is allowed to use spaces in the value field but not in the name field.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt9: Message parameter - Same as HTTP Message parameter
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt10: Send notifications continuously while rule is active - Check this box and enter the seconds interval for notifications to be sent while the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt12: Message parameter - This message will be received in a CGI-variable called 'Message' on the target HTTPS server. Note that including more than the maximum of 255 characters in this field will exclude some or all of the contents of Custom parameter. Spaces are allowed. For a list of modifiers that can be used in notifications, see modifiers.
action_rule_setup_h.sendNotific_Txt13: Custom parameter - Add any extra parameters here. Click Add and enter the name and parameter value. Note that it is allowed to use spaces in the value field but not in the name field.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt1: Send Video Clip - Sends video clip to recipients such as HTTP, FTP, Network Share, Email etc.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt2: Select view area - Choose view area from which to record and send a video clip when the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt3: Stream profile - Select the type of stream profile. Listed are the default stream profiles as well as any created under Stream Profiles.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt4: Duration - Set the length of the video to record.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt5: Pre-trigger time - Enter the number of seconds to include in the recording from time immediately before the rule was triggered.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt6: While the rule is active - Sends video clip only while the rule is active.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt7: Note: It is not possible to use While the rule is active to send video clip to Email because some email providers may have a limit on attachments, if this limit is reached for example through receiving and viewing a huge amount of images, it can result into an email account being locked for a specific time.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt7-1: Note: It is not possible to use While the rule is active to send video clip to Email because some email providers have security filters that prevent users from receiving or viewing large amount of attachments, from receiving scheduled emails and similar. Check the email provider's security policy to avoid your email account being locked or missing on your expected emails.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt8: Post-trigger time - Enter the number of seconds to include immediately after the rule was triggered. If While the rule is active is enabled, the time entered here will be added to the recording time after the rule is no longer active.
action_rule_setup_h.sendVideoclip_Txt9: Recipient - Recipients FTP, HTTP, HTTPS, Network share and email address (SMTP) are used to receive uploaded media files and notification messages. Select a recipient from the drop-down list or add a new one by clicking New Recipient.
action_rule_setup_h.folderNameLimit_Txt: Time modifiers used in the field Create folder are only used when an Action rule is triggered, hence no new folders are created with the current time during an active rule. To have new folders created with time modifiers during an active rule, add the modifiers in the Base filename.
action_rule_setup_h.folderNameLimitVid_Txt: Note: Time modifiers used in the field Create folder are only used when an Action rule is triggered, hence no new folders are created with the current time during an active rule. To have new folders created with time modifiers during an active rule, add the modifiers in the Base filename.
action_rule_setup_h.sendSNMP_trap_Txt: Send SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP trap message to the management system when the Axis product experiences fan failure, power supply failure, when shock detection occurs or other critical issues that are of interest to the operator. Enter the message that should be sent along with the trap in the Message field.
action_rule_setup_h.sendSNMP_trapNote_Txt: Make sure that SNMP is enabled and configured under System Options > Network > SNMP for this action to be successful.
action_rule_setup_h.sendSNMP_trap_Txt-1: Send SNMP Trap - Sends an SNMP trap message to the management system. This action allows the operator to send an SNMP trap message from any trigger available through the Action rule setup page. Enter the message that should be sent along with the trap in the Message field.
action_rule_setup_h.lED_Txt: Status LED - The status LED can be set to flash for the duration of the Action Rule or for a set number of seconds. Status LED can be used during installation and configuration to visually validate if trigger settings work correctly for example motion detection trigger. Choose color to flash from the LED color drop-down list.
action_rule_setup_h.failOver_Txt: Fallback action - A fallback action is started if the primary action cannot be started, for example if connection to a recipient cannot be established. It can be used to send email notifications to operator or perform any other specified action for example upload images to a secondary recipient.
action_rule_setup_h.wdrMode_Txt: WDR Mode - Sets WDR Mode or Lightfinder Mode when the Action Rule is triggered. This action may be used when needed to change between the modes automatically. Select WDR On or Lightfinder Mode for the product to be set to that specific mode when the Action Rule is triggered.
action_rule_setup_h.wdrModeOff_Txt: WDR Mode - Sets WDR Mode to On or Off when the Action Rule is triggered. This action may be used when needed to change between the modes automatically. Select WDR On or WDR Off for the product to be set to that specific mode when the Action Rule is triggered.

action_rules_h.intro_Txt1: Action rule setup allows you to set up rules to define how and when the unit will perform certain actions. Events may be set up as scheduled, recurring or triggered, for example when motion is detected, a disk is full or audio reaches a defined level.
action_rules_h.intro_Txt2: Actions performed when an event occurs can include sending an email, a notification through FTP, HTTP or TCP, and activation of an output port.
action_rules_h.list_Txt1: The Action Rule List shows all the rules currently configured in the product, along with various information about their configuration, as listed below:
action_rules_h.list_Txt2: Name - The name entered by the user when the rule was set up.
action_rules_h.list_Txt3: Trigger - The name of the trigger that activates the rule.
action_rules_h.list_Txt4: Schedule - The name of the schedule used. The name entered by the user when the schedule was set up.
action_rules_h.list_Txt5: Action - What action is performed for the event.
action_rules_h.list_Txt6: Recipient - The name of the recipient for email, FTP, HTTP or TCP.
action_rules_h.checkbox_Txt: Select/clear the check box in the column furthest to the left to enable/disable an action rule.
action_rules_h.button_Txt: To create a new Action rule, click Add.... To copy a rule, select an existing rule and click Copy... To change an existing rule, select the rule in the list and click Modify... To delete a rule, select it and click Remove.
action_rules_h.button_Txt-1: To create a new Action rule, click Add.... To change an existing rule, select the rule in the list and click Modify... To delete a rule, select it and click Remove.
action_rules_h.link_Txt: See Action Rule Setup for more information on how to set Action Rules.

additional_condition_h.intro_Txt: Select additional conditions that should be met before an action can take place. The selection made from the Events drop-down list and any additional events selected here would have to be active.
additional_condition_h.dropdown_Txt: Select a group of events from the drop-down list. A second drop-down list will then appear from which the desired event is selected.
additional_condition_h.trigger_appTrigger_Txt: Applications - Triggers the Action Rule through an application installed in Axis product. The use of this trigger depends on the purpose or function of the installed application. For more information on available applications, please see Application Packages or the Axis web site at www.axis.com
additional_condition_h.audioDetect_Txt1: Audio Detection - This is used to trigger the event every time the sound level rises above, or falls below the alarm level. See Audio Settings for more information.
additional_condition_h.audioDetect_Txt2: Audio Detection - This is used to trigger the event every time the sound level rises above, or falls below the alarm level. See Audio Settings for more information.
additional_condition_h.trigger_audioDetection_Txt: Audio Detection - Triggers the Action Rule when sound level rises above or falls below the alarm level. It can be used to start/stop recording or to notify operator in case of detection.
additional_condition_h.live_view_accessed_Txt: Live Stream Accessed - Triggers the Action Rule when a client accesses the live stream. The stream can be of any media type such as video, audio etc. The Action Rule can make use of status LED or an external light to notify persons that someone is actively monitoring.
additional_condition_h.trigger_onfilter_Txt1: Day/Night vision - Triggers the Action Rule when the camera switches between day and night mode (e.g. automatic IR Cut filter). It can be used to control an external infrared (IR) light through the output port.
additional_condition_h.trigger_onfilter_Txt2: Day on - Triggers the Action Rule when day/night vision is in day mode or switches to day mode.
additional_condition_h.trigger_onfilter_Txt3: Day off - Triggers the Action Rule when day/night vision is in night mode or switches to night mode.
additional_condition_h.trigger_motion_Txt: Motion Detection - Triggers the Action Rule when the Axis product built-in motion detection detects movement in a motion detection window. It is used mostly to control when to start recording and when not to with respect to motion detection window. Select the motion detection window from the drop-down list and specify whether to trigger Action Rule when there is movement or when there is no movement (Yes/No). A motion detection window needs to be created for the Motion detection trigger to be enabled. More about Motion detection.
additional_condition_h.trigger_PIR: PIR - Triggers the Action Rule when the PIR sensor detects motion. The passive infrared sensor is an electronic device that measures infrared (IR) light radiating from objects in its field of view. It is typically used to detect motion in dark areas and trigger the rule to perform actions such as record video, send notification etc. For more help see PIR Sensor.
additional_condition_h.trigger_tamper_Txt: Tampering - The product can trigger an alarm if it detects that someone has tampered with it, for example if the camera is repositioned or if the lens is covered. See also the help on Camera tampering.
additional_condition_h.trigger_fan_Txt: Fan - This triggers an event if the fan fails.
additional_condition_h.triggerCasingOpen_Txt: Casing Open - Triggers the Action Rule if the casing of a connected external device, such as a junction box is removed or opened. It can be used to send a notification to an operator if for example the casing has been opened for maintenance purposes or when someone has tampered with the casing.
additional_condition_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt1: Network - Triggers the Action Rule when Axis product looses network connection. Select one of the following options depending on the type of network connection used.
additional_condition_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt2: Any - Triggers the Action Rule if any of the network connection (cable or wireless) is lost.
additional_condition_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt3: eth0 - Triggers the Action Rule if network cable connection is lost.
additional_condition_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt4: eth1 - Triggers the Action Rule if wireless network connection is lost.
additional_condition_h.trigger_network_lost1_Txt5: Select the Yes radio button to trigger the Action Rule if the network connection is lost. Select No radio button to trigger the Action Rule when the network connection is restored.
additional_condition_h.trigger_network_lost2_Txt: Network - Triggers the Action Rule when network connection is lost. Select Yes radio button to trigger the Action Rule if the network connection is lost. Select No radio button to trigger the Action Rule when the network connection is restored.
additional_condition_h.trigger_temp_Txt1: Temperature - This will trigger the event if the temperature is within, rises or falls outside of the operating range of the product. Select from the drop-down list which sensor is within operating range.
additional_condition_h.trigger_videoloss_Txt: Video Signal - This trigger type can be used in conjunction with pre-trigger recording, to allow viewing of the recording up to the point when video was lost. It can also be used to notify users that the server has lost the video signal.
additional_condition_h.videoloss_note_Txt1: Note: When using this event type, the video source to detect video loss on does not have to be the same source as otherwise used by the event type. This means that it is possible to configure the event type so that losing the video signal on one input will trigger an upload from another video source.
additional_condition_h.videoloss_note_Txt2: However, if the same video source is used in both cases, this will disable post-event upload and continued image upload (see below).
additional_condition_h.trigger_inputs_Txt1: Input Signal - Below are the types of input ports supported by this Axis product. Configure I/O ports under System Options > Ports & Devices.
additional_condition_h.trigger_inputs_Txt1-1: Input Signal - Below are the types of input ports supported by this Axis product.
additional_condition_h.trigger_inputs_Txt5: Configure I/O ports under System Options > Ports & Devices.
additional_condition_h.trigger_inputs_Txt2: Digital Input Port - Triggers the Action Rule when digital input port changes state. It can be used to initiate various actions such as send notification, send images, record video etc. In third drop-down list, select an input port to trigger the Action Rule when that specific input port is active. Or select Any to trigger Action Rule when any input port is active.
additional_condition_h.trigger_inputs_Txt3: Virtual Inputs Triggers the Action Rule when any of the virtual inputs changes states. It can be used by external client such as Video Management Systems to initiate various actions. In the third drop-down list, select an input port to trigger the Action Rule when that specific input port is active.
additional_condition_h.trigger_inputs_Txt4: Manual Trigger - Triggers the Action Rule when manual trigger button changes state. It can be used to start or stop the Action Rule manually through Live View page. For this trigger to work, manual trigger button must be enabled in Live View Layout.
additional_condition_h.ptzAutoTrack_Txt: Autotracking - Triggers the Action Rule when PTZ autotracking starts, that is, autotracking has detected a moving object in the camera's field of view. It can be used to trigger the Action Rule to send a notification when autotracking starts to operate due to movement in the monitored area.
additional_condition_h.ptzReady_Txt: Ready - Triggers the Action Rule when PTZ is in ready status, for example Axis product can detect and send a notification when PTZ is ready to be used after restart. This trigger can be used to move Axis product to a specific preset position after restart.
additional_condition_h.ptzMove_Txt: Moving - Triggers the Action Rule when Axis product moves or not due to a PTZ operation. It can be used as an Additional Condition to stop other actions such as motion detection when PTZ is moving.
additional_condition_h.trigger_temp_Txt2: Preset Reached - Triggers the Action Rule when the view reaches at a preset position. This is useful for saving images from a guard tour, without saving images from when the Axis product is moving between presets or it can be used to upload an image at each preset position.
additional_condition_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt: Storage - Notifies operator that there exists storage related issues that need to be responded to. It can be used to trigger the Action Rule when a storage device is available, locked or full (i.e., it has less than 10 MB of free memory). Select the storage device from the drop-down list and select Yes or No for the desired trigger.
additional_condition_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt1: Storage - Notifies operator that there exists storage related issues that need to be responded to.
additional_condition_h.trigger_StorageDisruption_Txt: Storage Disruption - Triggers the Action Rule when storage problems are detected. This trigger may be used to send a notification to an operator if the storage device is unavailable, removed, full, locked or if there is a read or write problem. The operator may need to check the logs under System Options > Support > Logs & Reports to identify the problem and take necessary measures to fix them e.g. unmount and re-mount the storage device etc.
additional_condition_h.trigger_recStatus_Txt: Recording - Triggers the Action Rule when the Axis product records to the storage device. The recording status trigger can be used to notify the operator e.g by flashing LED lights, if the product has started or stopped to record to the storage device. Note that, this trigger can be used only for edge storage recording status.
additional_condition_h.trigger_disk2full_Txt6: Select the storage device from the drop-down list and select Yes for notification to be sent for example when the storage device is unmounted or removed, full, locked or if storage disruption is detected.
additional_condition_h.trigger_ready_Txt1: System Ready - Triggers the Action Rule when the system is in ready status, for example Axis product can detect and send a notification to operator after it has started.
additional_condition_h.trigger_ready_Txt2: Select Yes radio button to trigger the Action Rule when the product is in Ready state. Note that the rule will only trigger when all necessary services such as event system have started.
additional_condition_h.trigger_ready_Txt3: Note: Action Rule will not be triggered when the No radio button is selected.
additional_condition_h.trigger_onboot_Txt: System Initializing - Select the Yes radio button to trigger the Action Rule every time the product is started.
additional_condition_h.recur_Txt: Recurrences - This triggers a recurring event. Select the name of a recurrency pattern from the drop-down list. For more information about setting up a recurrency pattern, see Recurrences.
additional_condition_h.stateless_note: Note - Stateless events such as Tampering or Recurrences can not be used as an additional condition.

filenames_h.intro_txt_1: The Axis product supports the use of modifier fields. These can be used for adding information to notification messages. The modifiers available are listed below.
filenames_h.intro_txt_2: The Axis product supports the use of modifier fields. These can be used for modifying file names when uploading images, for formatting the date and time added to image overlays, and for adding information to notification messages. The modifiers available in each case are listed below.
filenames_h.syntax_txt: The format string can contain normal text and/or modifier fields, the latter which always start with a % or a # character, followed by another character. Anything else is considered normal text.
filenames_h.syntaxEx_txt: When for example, a new file is named, the format fields are replaced with values according to the options selected from the table below. All normal text is left as it is.
filenames_h.help5txt1: For example, the string image-%H-%M-%S.jpg will cause uploaded files to be timestamped with the hour, minute and second they were created, as follows:
filenames_h.note1_txt: Note: This type of formatting should not contain blank spaces.
filenames_h.modifiers_txt1: The available modifiers can each be used in various situations. The abbreviations given in brackets for each modifier show which situations the modifier can be used in. These are:
filenames_h.modifiers_txt5: IP - Notification of change of IP address
filenames_h.generalNote_txt: Note - Some modifiers contain characters that are not supported by all filesystems. For example, modifiers that returns time or MAC address %c, #m, #M contains the colon (:) character that is not supported in Windows filesystems.
filenames_h.help14txt-1:
